step_of_the_day.title:
Step of the Day:
            Taking responsibility for your reactions and emotions. You can reduce anxiety and gain control by taking
            greater responsibility for your life today (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.content:
"Life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it." Charles SwindolYou grow up being dependent on others. You learn to adapt to their approach and expectations. This is your
            primitive gestalt pattern. Part of this dependency gets transferred to your internal voice or internal
            parent. While it can feel safe to play by the rules you were given, it is a major constraint that keeps you
            dependent and ungrounded. It results in you worrying about what happens to you and what people say to you or
            about you.

action_step:
Make the decision that you want to determine your own beliefs and stand on your own two feet. Today, find
            situations in which to say â€œno\" to the voice/critic in your head. Instead, shift into the voice of your
            healthy internal parent. Hear the support that you get from this voice that comes from a place of love,
            compassion, acceptance, support and care. Notice if it results in you experiencing less anxiety and worry.
journal_entry: Write about your efforts to shift into a healthy internal voice.
